Problem:
Consider a control system modeled by the differential equation \\( dx/dt = Ax + Bu \\), where A is a system matrix and B is a control matrix, coupled with a control input u. We analyze the impact of applying a state-dependent transformation \\( f(x) = Cx \\) where C is a constant matrix.

If \\( f(x) \\) is applied to a vector \\( x_0 \\) at t = 0, then allowed to evolve under \\( dx/dt = Ax \\) without any further input (\\( u = 0 \\)), will \\( x(t) \\) at t = T be the same as if \\( x_0 \\) was directly evolved to t = T under \\( dx/dt = Ax \\) without transformation?
Explanation: Applying \\( f(x) \\) modifies the initial condition to \\( Cx_0 \\). The solution \\( x(t) \\) will evolve from this new initial state according to the system dynamics given by A, which in general results in a different state at time T compared to the evolution of the original \\( x_0 \\) without the transformation.
